item.title: Today I learned How to Read Stdout in Go Tests
item.description: Being able to read the output of a function can be useful to read some good your tests are failing. Here’s how I did it. The problem# I am currently in the middle of building my lightweight configuration loader called Pluma. I was writing tests for one of the exported helper functions FromEnv which is supposed to read configurations from the environment variables and load them into a map. All the test cases were passing except the ones where the user passes a prefix for the variables.
